author: sky.cactus
content: It would be convenient if you could say how many hours/minutes until the meeting in these posts so people don't have to try to do time zone conversions.  Discord messages include local timestamps, so if you say "in 23 hours" I can just look at the timestamp in discord and add 23 hours to get my local time.

author: sky.cactus
content: Yeah, I can do the conversion for myself certainly.  Easier for me than Americans since I live in a sane country that doesn't do daylight savings stuff.

author: sky.cactus
content: However, it would be a minor convenience if it was included in the post.  My thinking here is that the effort required for Pooja to give a "number of hours/minutes from now" is quite low (likely on-par with the effort required for me to do the conversion myself), but when you consider that *every* reader of the message has to do the conversion that extra effort be the author is likely "worth it" in terms of net productivity.

author: sky.cactus
content: Certainly not a hard requirement, just a minor point of feedback.

author: gcolvin
content: I find UTC much more helpful - an unambiguous standard.  The two bots above I found with a quick Google.  The second looks to do just what you want?

author: sky.cactus
content: Good point that some people may find a UTC timestamp more useful than a relative time.
